verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician <WH5329> upon Shoshannim, <WH7799> A Psalm of David. <WH1732> Save <WH3467> me, O God; <WH430> for the waters <WH4325> are come <WH935> in to my soul. <WH5315>
I sink <WH2883> in deep <WH4688> mire, <WH3121> where there is no <WH369> standing: <WH4613> I am come <WH935> into deep <WH4615> waters, <WH4325> where the floods <WH7641> overflow <WH7857> me.
I am weary <WH3021> of my crying: <WH7121> my throat <WH1627> is dried: <WH2787> my eyes <WH5869> fail <WH3615> while I wait <WH3176> for my God. <WH430>

They that hate <WH8130> me without <WH2600> a cause <WH2600> are more <WH7231> than the hairs <WH8185> of my head: <WH7218> they that would destroy <WH6789> me, being my enemies <WH341> wrongfully, <WH8267> are mighty: <WH6105> then <WH227> I restored <WH7725> that which <WH834> I took <WH1497> not away. <WH1497>
O God, <WH430> you know <WH3045> my foolishness; <WH200> and my sins <WH819> are not hid <WH3582> from you.

Let not them that wait <WH6960> on you, O Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts, <WH6635> be ashamed <WH954> for my sake: let not those that seek <WH1245> you be confounded <WH3637> for my sake, O God <WH430> of Israel. <WH3478>
Because <WH3588> for your sake <WH5921> I have borne <WH5375> reproach; <WH2781> shame <WH3639> has covered <WH3680> my face. <WH6440>
I am become <WH1961> a stranger <WH2114> to my brothers, <WH251> and an alien <WH5237> to my mother's <WH517> children. <WH1121>
For the zeal <WH7068> of your house <WH1004> has eaten <WH398> me up; and the reproaches <WH2781> of them that reproached <WH2778> you are fallen <WH5307> on me.
When I wept, <WH1058> and chastened my soul <WH5315> with fasting, <WH6685> that was to my reproach. <WH2781>
I made <WH5414> sackcloth <WH8242> also my garment; <WH3830> and I became <WH1961> a proverb <WH4912> to them.
They that sit <WH3427> in the gate <WH8179> speak <WH7878> against me; and I was the song <WH5058> of the drunkards. <WH8354> <WH7941>

But as for me, my prayer <WH8605> is to you, O LORD, <WH3068> in an acceptable <WH7522> time: <WH6256> O God, <WH430> in the multitude <WH7230> of your mercy <WH2617> hear <WH6030> me, in the truth <WH571> of your salvation. <WH3468>
Deliver <WH5337> me out of the mire, <WH2916> and let me not sink: <WH2883> let me be delivered <WH5337> from them that hate <WH8130> me, and out of the deep <WH4615> waters. <WH4325>
Let not the flood <WH7641> <WH4325> overflow <WH7857> me, neither <WH408> let the deep <WH4688> swallow <WH1104> me up, and let not the pit <WH875> shut <WH332> her mouth <WH6310> on me.
Hear <WH6030> me, O LORD; <WH3068> for your loving kindness <WH2617> is good: <WH2896> turn <WH6437> to me according to the multitude <WH7230> of your tender mercies. <WH7356>
And hide <WH5641> not your face <WH6440> from your servant; <WH5650> for I am in trouble: <WH6887> hear <WH6030> me speedily. <WH4118>
Draw near <WH7126> to my soul, <WH5315> and redeem <WH1350> it: deliver <WH6299> me because <WH4616> of my enemies. <WH341>
You have known <WH3045> my reproach, <WH2781> and my shame, <WH1322> and my dishonor: <WH3639> my adversaries <WH6887> are all <WH3605> before <WH5048> you.

Reproach <WH2781> has broken <WH7665> my heart; <WH3820> and I am full of heaviness: <WH5136> and I looked <WH6960> for some to take pity, <WH5110> but there was none; <WH369> and for comforters, <WH5162> but I found <WH4672> none. <WH3808>
They gave <WH5414> me also gall <WH7219> for my meat; <WH1267> and in my thirst <WH6772> they gave me vinegar <WH2558> to drink. <WH8248>
Let their table <WH7979> become <WH1961> a snare <WH6341> before <WH6440> them: and that which should have been for their welfare, <WH7965> let it become a trap. <WH4170>
Let their eyes <WH5869> be darkened, <WH2821> that they see <WH7200> not; and make their loins <WH4975> continually <WH8548> to shake. <WH4571>
Pour <WH8210> out your indignation <WH2195> on them, and let your wrathful <WH2740> anger <WH639> take <WH5381> hold <WH5381> of them.
Let their habitation <WH2918> be desolate; <WH8074> and let none <WH408> dwell <WH3427> in their tents. <WH168>
For they persecute <WH7291> him whom <WH834> you have smitten; <WH5221> and they talk <WH5608> to the grief <WH4341> of those whom you have wounded. <WH2491>
Add <WH5414> iniquity <WH5771> to their iniquity: <WH5771> and let them not come <WH935> into your righteousness. <WH6666>
Let them be blotted <WH4229> out of the book <WH5612> of the living, <WH2416> and not be written <WH3789> with the righteous. <WH6662>
But I am poor <WH6041> and sorrowful: <WH3510> let your salvation, <WH3444> O God, <WH430> set me up on high. <WH7682>
I will praise <WH1984> the name <WH8034> of God <WH430> with a song, <WH7892> and will magnify <WH1431> him with thanksgiving. <WH8426>
This also shall please <WH3190> the LORD <WH3068> better <WH3190> than an ox <WH7794> or bullock <WH6499> that has horns <WH7160> and hoofs. <WH6536>
The humble <WH6041> shall see <WH7200> this, and be glad: <WH8056> and your heart <WH3824> shall live <WH2421> that seek <WH1875> God. <WH430>
For the LORD <WH3068> hears <WH8085> the poor, <WH34> and despises <WH959> not his prisoners. <WH615>
Let the heaven <WH8064> and earth <WH776> praise <WH1984> him, the seas, <WH3220> and every <WH3605> thing that moves <WH7430> therein.
For God <WH430> will save <WH3467> Zion, <WH6726> and will build <WH1129> the cities <WH5892> of Judah: <WH3063> that they may dwell <WH3427> there, and have it in possession. <WH3423>
The seed <WH2233> also of his servants <WH5650> shall inherit <WH5157> it: and they that love <WH157> his name <WH8034> shall dwell <WH7931> therein.
